page.title: 01Rural Parish Of River Clyde
page.content: Grid reference no. 02920642 is a U shaped valley in the upper reaches of the River Clyde. The floor of the valley is 187 metres rising to 242 metres above sea level. The area is one of mixed farming. Most farms supporting a herd of dairy or beef cattle, producing silage, hay and barley as winter feed crops also potatoes and turnips. There are a number of small conifer plantations and the land in general supports a large number of deciduous trees mainly beech, ash, rowan and a few elms. Some fields are still bounded by hawthorne hedges. The village in the block is a small rural one supporting a church, primary school and post office. Many of the inhabitants are retired the rest work locally in agriculture the railway and quarring, a few travel to the large towns and
